metadata.title: CVE-2022-22592 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
A logic issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue isfixed in iOS 15.3 and iPadOS 15.3, watchOS 8.4, tvOS 15.3, Safari 15.3,macOS Monterey 12.2. Processing maliciously crafted web content may preventContent Security Policy from being enforced.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22592` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.35.3-1ubuntu1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.35.3-1ubuntu1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-6.0 - 2.35.3-1ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit-6.0 - 2.35.3-1ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.35.3-1ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.35.3-1ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.35.3-1ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.35.3-1ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.35.3-1ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-6.0-1 - 2.35.3-1ubuntu1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.35.3-1ubuntu1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.35.3-1ubuntu1
libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 - 2.35.3-1ubuntu1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.35.3-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.35.3-1ubuntu1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
